structure.unit: GENERAL PROVISIONS AS TO OFFICES AND OFFICERS -- SOCIAL SECURITY FOR PUBLIC EMPLOYEES -- EMPLOYEES RETIREMENT SYSTEM

law.catch_line: Referendum on coverage under agreement -- Separate system for state colleges.

text.section: Upon receiving satisfactory evidence that the conditions specified in this section and Section 218(d)(3) or 218(d)(7) of the Social Security Act have been fulfilled, the Governor or any agency or individual designated by the Governor shall so certify to the commissioner.

For purposes of this section, in any case where a retirement system covers the employees of two (2) or more political subdivisions, or of the Commonwealth and one (1) or more political subdivisions, there are deemed to exist separate retirement systems with respect to the Commonwealth or each political subdivision. Also for purposes of this section, where a retirement system covers the employees of one (1) or more of the state universities or of one (1) or more of the public junior colleges or of any combination of state universities, there shall be deemed to exist separate retirement systems with respect to each state university and each public junior college.

law.history: Amended 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 155, sec. 1, effective July 15, 2002. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 436, sec. 4, effective July 15, 1998. -- Created 1962 Ky. Acts ch. 12, sec. 4.
